assay_type slot definition.label: assay
assay_type slot definition.description: A planned process that has the objective to produce information about a material entity (the evaluant) by examining it.

assay_type slot definition.label: comet assay
assay_type slot definition.description: An assay that measures DNA damage (DNA breakage) in eucaryotic cells exposed to a challenge by determining the size and shape of DNA migration by detecting fluorescently labeled DNA from a cell placed in an electric field using gel electrophoresis

assay_type slot definition.label: pyrosequencing assay
assay_type slot definition.description: A DNA sequencing by synthesis assay which sequences a single strand of DNA by synthesizing the complementary strand along it, one base pair at a time, and detecting which base was actually added at each step. The template DNA is immobilized, and solutions of A, C, G, and T nucleotides are added and removed after the reaction, sequentially. Light is produced only when the nucleotide solution complements the first unpaired base of the template. The sequence of solutions which produce chemiluminescent signals allows the determination of the sequence of the template. ssDNA template is hybridized to a sequencing primer and incubated with the enzymes DNA polymerase, ATP sulfurylase, luciferase and apyrase, and with the substrates adenosine 5-prime phosphosulfate (APS) and luciferin.

measurement value slot definition.label: measurement datum
measurement value slot definition.description: A measurement datum is an information content entity that is a recording of the output of a measurement such as produced by a device.

measurement value slot definition.label: measurement datum
measurement value slot definition.description: A measurement datum is an information content entity that is a recording of the output of a measurement such as produced by a device.

measurement value slot definition.label: scalar measurement datum
measurement value slot definition.description: A scalar measurement datum is a measurement datum that is composed of two parts, numerals and a unit label.

protocol_notes slot definition.label: protocol
protocol_notes slot definition.description: A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process.

protocol_notes slot definition.label: sequencing protocol
protocol_notes slot definition.description: A protocol that, when concretized, is realized in an assay that uses chemical or biological means to infer the sequence of a biomaterial.

protocol_notes slot definition.label: rodent care protocol
protocol_notes slot definition.description: A rodent care protocol is an animal protocol in which the animals being taken care of are rodents.

input_sample slot definition.label: material entity
input_sample slot definition.description: An independent continuant that is spatially extended whose identity is independent of that of other entities and can be maintained through time.

input_sample slot definition.label: dissolved material entity
input_sample slot definition.description: A material entity that has been going through a process of being put into solution

instrumentation slot definition.label: PCR instrument
instrumentation slot definition.description: A device that is used to amplify a single or few copies of a piece of DNA across several orders of magnitude, generating thousands to millions of copies of a particular DNA sequence.

instrumentation slot definition.label: radiography instrument
instrumentation slot definition.description: An image acquisition device that uses ionizing electromagnetic radiation such as X-rays to view objects.

instrumentation slot definition.label: microdissection instrument
instrumentation slot definition.description: A device that is used for the dissection of tissues under magnification.

generic data slot definition.label: data item
generic data slot definition.description: An information content entity that is intended to be a truthful statement about something (modulo, e.g., measurement precision or other systematic errors) and is constructed/acquired by a method which reliably tends to produce (approximately) truthful statements.

generic data slot definition.label: data item extraction from journal article
generic data slot definition.description: A planned process in which journal articles are read or processed and data items are extracted, typically for further analysis or indexing

generic data slot definition.label: data set
generic data slot definition.description: A data item that is an aggregate of other data items of the same type that have something in common. Averages and distributions can be determined for data sets.

sample_type slot definition.label: specimen
sample_type slot definition.description: A material entity that is collected for potential use as an input upon which measurements or observations are performed.

sample_type slot definition.label: urine specimen
sample_type slot definition.description: a portion of urine collected from an organism

sample_type slot definition.label: blood specimen
sample_type slot definition.description: a material entity derived from a portion of blood collected from an organism

biological sample slot.label: material sample
biological sample slot.description: A material entity that has the material sample role

biological sample slot.label: sample inlet
biological sample slot.description: The column inlet (or injector) provides the means to introduce a sample into a continuous flow of carrier gas. The inlet is a piece of hardware attached to the column head.

method slot definition.label: planned process
method slot definition.description: A process that realizes a plan which is the concretization of a plan specification.

method slot definition.label: planned irradiation
method slot definition.description: A planned process by which a material entity is exposed to radiative energy, which could be ionizing radiation (such as gamma rays, X-rays, charged particles or neutrons) or non-ionizing radiation (such as UV light or microwaves)

method slot definition.label: unblinding process
method slot definition.description: A planned process that is the part of the study execution in which the subjects are told what study arm they are in and in which the investigators are told which subjects are in which trials.

method_assay slot definition.label: assay
method_assay slot definition.description: A planned process that has the objective to produce information about a material entity (the evaluant) by examining it.

method_assay slot definition.label: comet assay
method_assay slot definition.description: An assay that measures DNA damage (DNA breakage) in eucaryotic cells exposed to a challenge by determining the size and shape of DNA migration by detecting fluorescently labeled DNA from a cell placed in an electric field using gel electrophoresis

method_assay slot definition.label: pyrosequencing assay
method_assay slot definition.description: A DNA sequencing by synthesis assay which sequences a single strand of DNA by synthesizing the complementary strand along it, one base pair at a time, and detecting which base was actually added at each step. The template DNA is immobilized, and solutions of A, C, G, and T nucleotides are added and removed after the reaction, sequentially. Light is produced only when the nucleotide solution complements the first unpaired base of the template. The sequence of solutions which produce chemiluminescent signals allows the determination of the sequence of the template. ssDNA template is hybridized to a sequencing primer and incubated with the enzymes DNA polymerase, ATP sulfurylase, luciferase and apyrase, and with the substrates adenosine 5-prime phosphosulfate (APS) and luciferin.

documentation slot definition.label: document
documentation slot definition.description: A collection of information content entities intended to be understood together as a whole

documentation slot definition.label: document title
documentation slot definition.description: A textual entity that names a document

documentation slot definition.label: document part
documentation slot definition.description: An information content entity that is part of a document.

sop_reference slot definition.label: standard error
sop_reference slot definition.description: A quantitative confidence value which is the standard deviations of the sample in a frequency distribution, obtained by dividing the standard deviation by the total number of cases in the frequency distribution.

sop_reference slot definition.label: standard deviation calculation
sop_reference slot definition.description: A standard deviation calculation is a descriptive statistics calculation defined as the square root of the variance.  Also thought of as the average distance of each value to the mean.

sop_reference slot definition.label: standard compliance rule
sop_reference slot definition.description: a  standard compliance rule is a compliance rule which defines conformity to a representation standard

imaging_modality value.label: lightsheet fluorescence microscopy assay
imaging_modality value.description: A fluorescence microscopy that involves capturing of photons emitted by fluorophores excited with a thin sheet of laser light in a sample only in a relatively narrow plane by a detection objective oriented perpendicularly to the light sheet and imaged onto a detection device such as a CCD camera.

imaging_modality value.label: fluorescence microscopy assay
imaging_modality value.description: Any type of light microscopy assay where the specimen can be made to fluoresce (emit energy as visible light) by illuminating it with light of specific wavelengths. These specimens are called fluorophores.

imaging_modality value.label: confocal fluorescence microscopy assay
imaging_modality value.description: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce (emit energy as visible light) by scanning a gas (Ar or Kr) laser spot of specific wavelength over its surface and using a spatial pinhole to eliminate out-of-focus fluorescence.

sample_type value.label: respiratory system
sample_type value.description: Functional system which consists of structures involved in respiration.

sample_type value.label: respiratory system mucus
sample_type value.description: Any mucus produced by a mucosae of the respiratory system. This includes the mucus produced in the nasal cavity (nasal mucus) and mucus produced in the respiratory tract (phlegm).

sample_type value.label: respiratory system gland
sample_type value.description: Any gland that is part os the respiratory system.

staining_type value.label: histological assay
staining_type value.description: An assay that uses visual examination of cells or tissue (or images of them) to make an assessment regarding a quality of the cells or tissue. This assay can include steps of staining, imaging, and judgement.

staining_type value.label: staining
staining_type value.description: Staining is a process which results in the addition a class-specific (DNA, proteins, lipids, carbohydrates) dye to a substrate to qualify or quantify the presence of a specific compound.

staining_type value.label: histological sample preparation
staining_type value.description: histological sample preparation is the preparation of an input tissue via slicing and labeling to make tissue microstructure of interest visible in a future histology assay

fixation_method value.label: paraformaldehyde polymer
fixation_method value.description: A poly(oxymethylene) polymer, composed of paraformaldehyde macromolecules.

fixation_method value.label: paraformaldehyde macromolecule
fixation_method value.description: A macromolecule composed of repeating methyleneoxy units arising from polymerisation of formaldehyde.

analysis_method value.label: PCR instrument
analysis_method value.description: A device that is used to amplify a single or few copies of a piece of DNA across several orders of magnitude, generating thousands to millions of copies of a particular DNA sequence.

analysis_method value.label: PCR program
analysis_method value.description: a PCR program is a plan specification which is executed during a polymerase chain reaction (PCR) by a thermocycler instrument that will iterate through the changes in temperature and duration of each of the annealing, denaturation, elongation steps for as many times as specified by the program.

analysis_method value.label: PCR product
analysis_method value.description: is double stranded DNA that is the specified output of a polymerase chain reaction

culture condition.label: cell culture
culture condition.description: A material entity comprised of cultured cells and the media in which they are being propagated or stored.

culture condition.label: cell culture expansion
culture condition.description: a process that results in the increase of cell numbers

culture condition.label: primary cell culture
culture condition.description: A cell culture comprised of primary cultured cells and the media in which they are being actively propaged or quiescently stored.

culture_medium value.label: culture medium
culture_medium value.description: a processed material that provides the needed nourishment for microorganisms or cells grown in vitro.

culture_medium value.label: enrichment culture medium
culture_medium value.description: A culture medium that is designed to favor the growth of a particular microorganism or cells over others, enriching a sample for the microorganism or cells of interest.

culture_medium value.label: Dulbecco's modified Eagle medium
culture_medium value.description: A culture medium containing iron, phenol red, amino acids, salts, glucose and vitamins.

distance unit.label: micrometer
distance unit.description: "A length unit which is equal to one millionth of a meter or 10^[-6] m." [NIST:NIST]

distance unit.label: micrometer
distance unit.description: "A length unit which is equal to one millionth of a meter or 10^[-6] m." [NIST:NIST]

distance unit.label: square micrometer
distance unit.description: "An area unit which is equal to an area enclosed by a square with sides each 1 micrometer long." [NIST:NIST]

frequency unit.label: hertz
frequency unit.description: "A frequency unit which is equal to 1 complete cycle of a recurring phenomenon in 1 second." [NIST:NIST]

frequency unit.label: hertz
frequency unit.description: "A frequency unit which is equal to 1 complete cycle of a recurring phenomenon in 1 second." [NIST:NIST]

ratio unit.label: mass percentage
ratio unit.description: "A dimensionless concentration unit which denotes the mass of a substance in a mixture as a percentage of the mass of the entire mixture." [Wikipedia:Wikipedia]

ratio unit.label: volume percentage
ratio unit.description: "A dimensionless concentration unit which denotes the volume of the solute in mL per 100 mL of the resulting solution." [UOC:GVG]

ratio unit.label: purity percentage
ratio unit.description: "A dimensionless percent unit which denotes the homogeneity of a biomaterial." [MGED:MGED]

environmental parameter.label: humidity
environmental parameter.description: A quality inhering in air by virtue of the partial pressure exerted by the bearer's water vapour content.

environmental parameter.label: humidity
environmental parameter.description: A quality inhering in air by virtue of the partial pressure exerted by the bearer's water vapour content.

biological process.label: mucus secretion
biological process.description: The regulated release of mucus by the mucosa. Mucus is a viscous slimy secretion consisting of mucins and various inorganic salts dissolved in water, with suspended epithelial cells and leukocytes. The mucosa, or mucous membrane, is the membrane covered with epithelium that lines the tubular organs of the body. Mucins are carbohydrate-rich glycoproteins that have a lubricating and protective function.

biological process.label: regulation of mucus secretion
biological process.description: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the regulated release of mucus from a cell or a tissue.

biological process.label: negative regulation of mucus secretion
biological process.description: Any process that stops, prevents, or reduces the frequency, rate or extent of the regulated release of mucus from a cell or a tissue.
